alert.note: Alert for Uintah (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 02 at 12:53PM MDT until June 03 at 7:00AM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Utah... Duchesne River near Randlett affecting Uintah County. .Warm temperatures and chance for rain on snow will continue to melt snowpack and increase river and stream flows. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding caused by rainfall and snowmelt will continue. * WHERE...Duchesne River near Randlett. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 11.5 feet, minor flooding is expected across low-lying agricultural land along the Duchesne River. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:00 PM MDT Friday the stage was 11.8 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate above bankfull conditions with a maximum value of 11.8 feet this evening. - Action stage is 11.6 feet. - Flood stage is 13.3 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
